revised_title: Nitrogenase of Klebsiella Pneumoniae: An MgATP Hydrolysing Energy Transduction System with Similarities to Actomyosin and p21ras
tldr: This article discusses the mechanism of ATP hydrolysis by nitrogenase, an enzyme found in certain bacteria that catalyzes the reduction of nitrogen to ammonia. The process is coupled to the evolution and hydrolysis of ATP. The article explores the similarities between nitrogenase, actomyosin, and p21ras in terms of their energy transduction and signaling mechanisms.
